summary: The code defines the "main" function, which is the entry point of a Haskell program. It prints the strings "hello" and "world" to the console using the "putStrLn" function. This simple script demonstrates a basic Haskell program that outputs two greetings.

details.comment: The code defines the "main" function, which is the entry point of a Haskell program. It prints the strings "hello" and "world" to the console using the "putStrLn" function. This simple script demonstrates a basic Haskell program that outputs two greetings.
details.content:
main :: IO ()
main = do
  putStrLn "hello"
  putStrLn "world"
